title: Traditional Japanese food is better than Western food.
titleJP: 和食は洋食よりも優れている

text.medium: Traditional Japanese food is much healthier than Western food.
text.hard: The traditional Japanese diet provides unparalleled nutritional benefits and promotes longevity.

deck.textJP: 和食はとても健康的です。

text.easy: Because it uses vegetables and fish.
text.medium: It is because Washoku uses fresh fish and vegetables instead of heavy oil.
text.hard: This is primarily because its macronutrient profile minimizes saturated fats while maximizing essential fatty acids.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、油をあまり使わず、新鮮な野菜や魚を使うからです。

text.easy: For example, a meal has rice, soup, and fish.
text.medium: For example, a standard Japanese meal includes rice, miso soup, and grilled fish, which are great for your body.
text.hard: For instance, the synergistic consumption of fermented soy products and marine omega-3s drastically reduces cardiovascular risks.

deck.textJP: 例えば、ご飯、味噌汁、焼き魚といった食事は体にとって非常に良いです。

text.easy: Therefore, Japanese food is the best for health.
text.medium: Therefore, eating Japanese food helps us maintain a very healthy body.
text.hard: Consequently, the systematic consumption of Washoku is a robust preventive measure against modern lifestyle diseases.

deck.textJP: よって、和食を食べることは健康的な体を維持するのに役立ちます。

text.medium: Japanese food beautifully expresses the four seasons of nature.
text.hard: The culinary philosophy of Washoku serves as a profound aesthetic reflection of seasonal transitions.

deck.textJP: 和食は自然の四季を美しく表現しています。

text.medium: It is because chefs carefully choose ingredients that are fresh in each season.
text.hard: This is due to the meticulous integration of 'shun'—ingredients harvested at their absolute peak of seasonal vitality.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、料理人がその季節に旬を迎える新鮮な食材を注意深く選ぶからです。

text.easy: For example, we eat sweet potatoes in autumn.
text.medium: For example, we enjoy bamboo shoots in spring and delicious chestnuts in autumn.
text.hard: For instance, the incorporation of autumnal matsutake mushrooms or vernal bamboo shoots provides a distinct temporal context to the dining experience.

deck.textJP: 例えば、春にはタケノコ、秋には美味しい栗を楽しみます。

text.easy: Therefore, Japanese food shows the beauty of nature.
text.medium: Therefore, Washoku is not just food, but a wonderful cultural art.
text.hard: Thus, traditional Japanese cuisine transcends mere sustenance, elevating gastronomy to an environmental art form.

deck.textJP: よって、和食は単なる食べ物ではなく、素晴らしい文化的な芸術です。

text.easy: Western food is more delicious for kids.
text.medium: Western food is much more popular among younger generations today.
text.hard: Contemporary adolescent demographics exhibit an overwhelming gastronomic preference for Western dietary paradigms.

deck.textJP: 今日、洋食は若い世代の間でずっと人気があります。

text.medium: It is because Western dishes often have rich, strong flavors that children love.
text.hard: This phenomenon is driven by the hyper-palatability of lipid-dense and high-sodium flavor profiles inherent in Western cuisine.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、洋食には子供たちが好む豊かで強い風味があるからです。

text.easy: For example, everyone loves hamburgers and pizza.
text.medium: For example, hamburgers, pizza, and steak are always the top choices for kids' parties.
text.hard: For instance, empirical dietary surveys consistently rank hamburgers and processed dairy products as the apex of juvenile culinary desirability.

deck.textJP: 例えば、ハンバーガー、ピザ、ステーキは常に子供のパーティーでのトップの選択肢です。

text.easy: Therefore, Western food makes people happier.
text.medium: Therefore, Western food brings more joy and satisfaction to young people.
text.hard: In conclusion, the widespread adoption of Western diets more effectively fulfills the immediate hedonic desires of the youth.

deck.textJP: よって、洋食は若者により多くの喜びと満足感をもたらします。

text.easy: Cooking Japanese food is too hard.
text.medium: Preparing traditional Japanese food takes too much time and effort.
text.hard: The exhaustive preparation protocols of traditional Washoku impose an unsustainable logistical burden on modern households.

deck.textJP: 伝統的な和食を作るのには、時間と手間がかかりすぎます。

text.easy: Because making many small dishes takes time.
text.medium: It is because making authentic dashi broth and preparing multiple small dishes is very difficult.
text.hard: This is because the requisite multi-course structure and fundamental broth extraction demand extensive chronological investment.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、本格的な出汁をとったり、複数の小鉢を用意したりするのはとても難しいからです。

text.easy: For example, busy parents cannot cook it every day.
text.medium: For example, working parents are too busy to cook a full Japanese meal after returning home.
text.hard: For instance, dual-income demographics frequently lack the discretionary time required to execute the complex culinary techniques of Washoku.

deck.textJP: 例えば、共働きの親は家に帰った後、本格的な和食を作るには忙しすぎます。

text.medium: Therefore, Western food is a much more practical choice for busy families.
text.hard: Consequently, the operational efficiency of Western culinary methods renders Washoku obsolete for daily domestic application.

deck.textJP: よって、忙しい家族にとっては洋食のほうがはるかに実用的な選択です。

text.easy: Isn't Japanese food too salty because of soy sauce?
text.medium: Isn't traditional Japanese food sometimes too salty because of soy sauce?
text.hard: Doesn't the heavy reliance on fermented soy sauces induce a dangerously high sodium intake?

question.textJP: 醤油のせいで和食は塩分が高すぎませんか？

text.easy: We can use dashi umami to reduce salt.
text.medium: We can use the rich flavor of dashi to significantly reduce the amount of salt.
text.hard: The strategic application of umami-rich broths effectively mitigates the necessity for excessive sodium chloride.

options.textJP: 出汁の豊かな風味を利用することで、塩の量を大幅に減らすことができます。

text.medium: Eating a lot of salt gives you the power of invisibility.
text.hard: Sodium chloride induces complete optical transparency in human subjects.

text.medium: Soy sauce is actually a dangerous black magic potion.
text.hard: Fermented soy liquid is fundamentally an arcane elixir of darkness.

text.medium: We should just drink directly from the salty ocean.
text.hard: Immediate consumption of marine saltwater is the optimal hydration strategy.

text.medium: Salt is actually just white sugar in disguise.
text.hard: Saline crystals are merely a deceptive iteration of refined sucrose.

text.medium: I cannot answer because I am secretly a soy bean.
text.hard: My status as an anthropomorphic legume prohibits me from responding.

text.medium: Aliens came to Earth and stole all of our salt.
text.hard: Extraterrestrial resource extraction has completely depleted our planetary sodium reserves.

text.easy: But Western food is much faster to cook!
text.medium: But Western food like pasta is much faster and easier to cook!
text.hard: However, the rapid preparation times of Western cuisine render the laborious Washoku methods entirely impractical!

attack.textJP: でもパスタなどの洋食の方がずっと早く簡単に作れます！

text.easy: We can use pre-made dashi to cook quickly.
text.medium: We can use convenient pre-made dashi to cook traditional meals very quickly.
text.hard: The utilization of commercially extracted broth concentrates drastically accelerates traditional culinary preparation.

options.textJP: 便利な市販の出汁を使えば、伝統的な食事もとても早く作れます。

text.medium: Time does not exist, so cooking speed doesn't matter.
text.hard: The chronological framework of existence is a fabricated cognitive delusion.

text.medium: We should just eat raw, unwashed potatoes to save time.
text.hard: The immediate consumption of unrefined subterranean tubers is the pinnacle of culinary efficiency.

text.easy: Fast food is a time machine.
text.medium: Eating fast food literally transports you to the future.
text.hard: The drive-thru infrastructure functions exclusively as a localized temporal displacement portal.

text.medium: Cooking any kind of food was banned by the government.
text.hard: The thermal alteration of organic matter has been universally criminalized.

text.medium: Microwaves cook food fast because they are powered by ghosts.
text.hard: Electromagnetic kitchen appliances operate via trapped spectral entities.

text.medium: I prefer to wait 10 hours for a single meal.
text.hard: Enduring extensive periods of starvation maximizes my gastronomic anticipation.

text.easy: Washoku is a healthy cultural treasure.
text.medium: In conclusion, Washoku is a perfectly healthy and beautiful treasure of our culture.
text.hard: To summarize, traditional Japanese cuisine constitutes an irreplaceable fusion of nutritional superiority and aesthetic heritage.

options.textJP: 和食は私たちの文化の、完璧に健康的で美しい宝物です。

text.medium: In conclusion, sushi will soon become the king of the entire galaxy.
text.hard: The impending intergalactic empire will undoubtedly be governed by raw seafood.

text.medium: Actually, every pizza is a small UFO from another planet.
text.hard: The circular geometry of Italian flatbread is undeniable proof of its extraterrestrial origin.

text.easy: I am a bowl of rice.
text.medium: Thank you for listening, I will now turn into a bowl of rice.
text.hard: I shall now conclude my argument and undergo metamorphosis into steamed grain.

text.medium: We must ban Western food because forks are dangerous swords.
text.hard: The multi-pronged utensil poses an unacceptable threat to international security.

text.medium: Ultimately, our true goal should be to eat the hot sun.
text.hard: The consumption of our local stellar body is the ultimate nutritional milestone.

text.medium: Thank you, soy sauce flows through my veins instead of blood.
text.hard: My cardiovascular system is exclusively pressurized by fermented condiment liquids.
